member.name: Amy Zhang
member.bio: Amy X. Zhang is an assistant professor at University of Washington's Allen School of Computer Science and Engineering, where she directs the Social Futures Lab. Her research interests are in social computing and HCI.

member.name: Quan Ze (Jim) Chen
member.bio: Quan Ze (Jim) is a former PhD student, now postdoc in SFL. He is interested in understading disagreement and ambiguity in human annotation and building  crowdsourcing and human-in-the loop workflows.

member.name: Xinyi Zhou
member.bio: Xinyi Zhou is a Postdoctoral Scholar at the University of Washington. Her research interests are broadly in the intersection of data mining, machine learning, natural language processing, and social computing and their applications to combat m/disinformation.

member.name: Nick Vincent
member.bio: Nick is a Postdoctoral Scholar working with the Social Futures Lab at UW and the Computational Communication Lab at UC Davis. His research aims to give the public more voice in determing how the AI systems we all contribute data to are used.

member.name: Ruotong Wang
member.bio: Ruotong Wang is a Ph.D. student at University of Washington CSE. She is interested in understanding and developing sociotechnical systems that facilitate communication and collaboration among diverse community members.

member.name: Galen Weld
member.bio: Galen Weld is a PhD student whose work focuses primarily on large-scale analyses of social media platforms' governance and content moderation strategies, with a particular focus on reddit.

member.name: Kevin Feng
member.bio: Kevin is a PhD student in Human Centered Design & Engineering at the University of Washington. His is interested in systems and tools that foster collaboration between diverse stakeholders, particularly within UX design and machine learning workflows.

member.name: Jina Yoon
member.bio: Jina Yoon is a PhD student of Computer Science at the University of Washington. Her current research interests are in fostering empathetic conversation, combating misinformation, and leveraging addictive design for good. She also really likes to play video games.

member.name: Leijie Wang
member.bio: Leijie Wang is a PhD student of Computer Science at the University of Washington. He's interested at understanding and developing content moderation systems that respect people's expectations about privacy and fairness on various online platforms.

member.name: Emelia May Hughes
member.bio: Emelia Hughes is an undergraduate student at the University of Washington studying Informatics and Drawing & Painting. Her research interests are in human-computer interaction, and she is currently focusing on the UX surrounding credibility.

member.name: Jenny Fan
member.bio: Jenny Fan is a designer and creative technologist interested in studying and reimagining digital civics in the online public sphere. She received her Masters in Design Engineering from Harvard University and B.S. Economics (with a focus on Information Systems) from the University of Pennsylvania, Wharton.

member.name: Anson Huang
member.bio: Anson Huang is an undergraduate student at the University of Washington studying computer science and political science. His research interests are in the intersection of civics and tech.

member.name: Ryan Li
member.bio: Ryan Li is an undergraduate student at the University of Washington majoring in Computer Science and minoring in Data Science. His research interests are in online misinformation and disinformation.

member.name: Alice Zhang
member.bio: Alice Zhang is an undergraduate student at the University of Minnesota-Twin Cities studying computer science. Her research interests are in the intersection of human-computer interaction, education, and communication.

member.name: Peipei Nie
member.bio: Peipei Nie is a social computing researcher from the University of Michigan's School of Information interested in our information ecosystem’s impact on democracy. Her research focuses on content moderation, mis/disinformation and trust, and news and civic engagement with applications to social media and online communities.

member.name: Andre Ye
member.bio: Andre Ye is an undergraduate student at the University of Washington studying computer science and philosophy. His primary research interest is in building more robust and responsible machine & deep learning systems.

member.name: Simona Liao
member.bio: Simona Liao (she/they) is an undergraduate student at the University of Washington studying computer science and GWSS (Gender, Women, and Sexuality Studies). She is interested in Virtual Reality platforms and communities, and how to design them against harassments.

member.name: Lin Qiu
member.bio: Lin Qiu is an undergraduate student at the University of Washington studying Computer Science. Her research interests are in human-computer interaction and she is currently working on improving collaboration in small online meetings.

member.name: Tony Li
member.bio: Tony (he/him) is a master's student in the HCDE department at the UW. He is also the president of the HCDE Graduate Student Association. WIth industry experience in data engineering, Tony is interested in human-AI interaction and the intersection of data and HCI.

member.name: Shreya Sathyanarayanan
member.bio: Shreya Sathyanarayanan is an undergraduate student at the University of Washington studying Computer Science. Her research interests are in Human-Computer Interaction, designing and developing tools for online collaboration, and addressing misinformation.

member.name: Kianna Bolante
member.bio: Kianna Bolante is an undergraduate student at the University of Washington studying Computer Science. Her research interests are in human-computer interaction, social computing, and education.

member.name: Teanna Barrett
member.bio: Teanna Barrett (she/her) is an undergraduate student at Howard University majoring in computer science with a minor in philosophy. Her research interests lie within the intersections of social computing, machine learning ethics/fairness, and digital activism.

member.name: Kevin Chen
member.bio: Kevin Chen is a student at Cleveland STEM High School's School of Engineering & Design (SOED). His research interests include usability, general programming, and societal impacts surrounding computer science.

member.name: Pranati Dani
member.bio: Pranati is an undergraduate student at UW studying Computer Science and minoring in Business Administration. She is extremely interested in the connection between communication and education with computing, and is working on the bridge between asynchronous and synchronous communication.

member.name: Sarah Fredrickson
member.bio: Sarah is an undergraduate student at the University of Washington studying computer science. Her research interests are in content moderation, online communities, and addressing misinformation.
